intro: Sloanea brenesii, commonly known as the Guatemalan sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in countries like Guatemala, Belize, and Honduras. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Sloanea brenesii grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 10 meters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils.
